API_Description: Removes a specified approval script from a document.
API_Description_Reason: The method name 'removeApprovalDocScript' suggests that it is used to remove a script related to document approval. This aligns with the collaboration functionality of the Collab object.
Returns: A boolean indicating whether the script was successfully removed.
Returns_Reason: Typically, methods that perform an action like removing an item return a boolean to indicate success or failure.

doc.description: The document object from which the approval script will be removed.
doc.description_reason: The parameter name 'doc' implies it is a document object, which is common in APIs dealing with document manipulation.
doc.type_reason: The 'doc' parameter is likely a document object, as it is a common type used in document-related operations.

scriptName.description: The name of the approval script to be removed from the document.
scriptName.description_reason: The parameter 'scriptName' suggests it specifies the name of the script to be removed, which is necessary to identify the correct script.
scriptName.type_reason: The 'scriptName' is likely a string because it represents the name of the script, which is typically a text identifier.
